title: Self Activity: Build Approval and Review Process

sections.content: This hands-on activity walks you through creating a multi-stage approval workflow in Zoho CRM. You'll learn to design approval processes for deals, quotes, discounts, or any custom scenario requiring review and authorization.

items: Zoho CRM Professional Edition or higher (required for Approval Processes)
Admin or workflow configuration permissions
Clear understanding of your approval hierarchy
Identified use case (deal approval, discount approval, etc.)

sections.content: Before building, clearly define what needs approval in your business:

items: **Large Deals:** Require manager approval for deals over a certain amount
**Discounts:** Route discount requests to sales leadership for authorization
**Quotes:** Multi-level review before sending quotes to customers
**Contract Changes:** Legal and finance review for contract modifications
**Custom Records:** Approval for partner applications, vendor requests, etc.

sections.content: For this activity, choose **one scenario** to implement. Let's use a deal approval process as our example.
Determine the approval hierarchy and conditions:

items: **Level 1:** Deals under $10,000 → Direct Manager approval
**Level 2:** Deals $10,000-$50,000 → Director approval
**Level 3:** Deals over $50,000 → VP or Executive approval
Discount percentage thresholds
Deal stage (e.g., only require approval at "Proposal" stage)
Product type or deal category
Customer type (new vs. existing)

sections.content: Navigate to Zoho CRM and set up your approval workflow:

items: Go to **Setup > Automation > Approval Processes**
Click **Create Approval Process**
Select the module (e.g., Deals)
Name your process (e.g., "Deal Value Approval Process")
Define the **entry criteria** (when should this approval trigger?)
Example: Deal Stage = "Proposal" AND Amount > $10,000

sections.content: Build the approval workflow with multiple levels:

items: **Add Step 1:** Define first level approver (e.g., Record Owner's Manager)
Set conditions: If Amount < $50,000
**Add Step 2:** Define second level approver (e.g., VP of Sales)
Set conditions: If Amount >= $50,000
Configure what happens when approved vs. rejected at each step
Record Owner's Manager (from role hierarchy)
Specific user (e.g., John Smith)
Role-based (e.g., anyone in Sales Director role)
Custom field value (approver specified in a lookup field)

sections.content: Step 5: Set Up Actions and Notifications
Configure what happens during the approval process:

items: Send email to approver with deal details
Update a status field (e.g., "Pending Approval")
Lock certain fields to prevent changes during review
Create a task for the submitter to follow up
Move deal to next stage (e.g., "Approved - Send Quote")
Send confirmation email to deal owner
Update approval status field
Trigger subsequent workflows or blueprints
Move deal back to previous stage or set to "On Hold"
Send notification explaining why it was rejected
Create task for sales rep to revise and resubmit
Log the rejection in the timeline

sections.content: Before rolling out to your team, thoroughly test the workflow:

items: Create test deals that meet the approval criteria
Submit them for approval and verify notifications are sent
Test approval path as the approver (approve some, reject others)
Verify that actions trigger correctly (stage changes, emails, etc.)
Test edge cases (e.g., what if approver is on vacation?)

sections.content: **Set Up Delegation:** Configure delegate approvers for when primary approvers are unavailable.

items: Confirm approvers receive clear, actionable approval requests
Verify approvals route to the correct person based on conditions
Check that rejected items go back to the right stage/owner
Test multi-level approvals (does it escalate properly?)
Review audit trail to track approval history

sections.content: Once your basic approval process works, consider these improvements:

items: **Parallel Approvals:** Require approval from multiple people simultaneously (e.g., both Sales Manager AND Finance)
**Time-Based Escalation:** Auto-escalate to next level if no response within X hours/days
**Conditional Paths:** Different approval routes based on product type or region
**Comments and Attachments:** Require approvers to add comments explaining decisions
**Dashboard for Approvers:** Create a custom view showing all pending approvals
How does this approval process improve accountability in your sales cycle?
What bottlenecks might arise? How can you prevent them?
Should certain users bypass approvals? (e.g., senior sales reps)
How will you measure the efficiency of this process?
What other processes in your business could benefit from structured approvals?
Create approval processes for quotes, discounts, or contract changes
Integrate approvals with your blueprint for seamless workflows
Set up reports to track approval times and bottlenecks
Train your team on how to submit items for approval
Review and optimize approval criteria quarterly based on data
